name: Yueming Wu 0001
content: Yueming Wu Yueming Wu(吴月明) I am currently an associate professor in the school of Cyber Science and Engineering of Huazhong University of Science and Technology. I was a research fellow in the School of Computer Science and Engineering at Nanyang Technological University advised by Prof. Yang Liu from 2022-2025. I received my Ph.D. in Cyberspace Security from Huazhong University of Science and Technology in 2021, advised by Prof. Deqing Zou & Wei Yang, and my B.E. in Information Security from Southwest Jiaotong University in 2016. News | Research Interest | Publications | Services | Awards Email: yuemingwu@hust.edu.cn [Google Scholar] [ORCID] News [2025.10] Our paper "EMC: A Semantic-Enhanced Malware Classification Method with Robustness and Scalability" is accepted by ICSE'2026 [2025.10] Our paper "CentSCA:基于中心性分析的C/C++软件成分分析方法" is accepted by 计算机学报'2025 [2025.10] Our paper "What is Wrong with Your Code Generated by Large Language Models? An Extensive Study" is accepted by SCIS'2025 [2025.09] Our paper "A Scalable Vulnerability Detection System with Multi-View Graph Representations" is accepted by TOSEM'2025 [2025.08] Our paper "VulSCA: A Community-Level SCA Approach for Accurate C/C++ Supply Chain Vulnerability Analysis" is accepted by NDSS'2026 [2025.08] Our paper "Demystifying the Evolution of Neural Networks with BOM Analysis: Insights from a Large-Scale Study of 55,997 GitHub Repositories" is accepted by ASE'2025 [2025.04] Our paper "BinCoFer: Three-Stage Purification for Effective C/C++ Binary Third-Party Library Detection" is accepted by JSS'2025 [2025.04] Our paper "MalScan: Android Malware Detection Based on Social-Network Centrality Analysis" is accepted by TDSC'2025 [2025.03] Our paper "VulFewShot: 利用对比学习改进少样本漏洞分类检测" is accepted by 软件学报'2025 [2025.03] Our paper "Fine-grained Code Clone Detection by Keywords-based Connection of Program Dependency Graph" is accepted by TR'2025 [2025.01] Our paper "Fighting Fire with Fire: Continuous Attack for Adversarial Android Malware Detection" is accepted by USENIX Security'2025 [2025.01] Our paper "Vulseye: Detect Smart Contract Vulnerabilities via Stateful Directed Graybox Fuzzing" is accepted by TIFS'2025 [2024.11] Our paper "Towards Effective Detection of Ponzi schemes on Ethereum with Contract Runtime Behavior Graph" is accepted by TOSEM'2024 [2024.08] Our paper "TokenScout: Early Detection of Ethereum Scam Tokens via Temporal Graph Learning" is accepted by CCS'2024 [2024.08] Our paper "The Software Genome Project: Unraveling Software Through Genetic Principles" is accepted by ASE NIER'2024 [2024.07] Our paper "MalSensor: Fast and Robust Windows Malware Classification" is accepted by TOSEM'2024 [2024.07] Our paper "A Concept Drift-Resistant Malware Classification Method Based on BERT and Autoencoder" is accepted by JOS'2024 [2024.07] Our paper "Uncovering and Mitigating the Impact of Code Obfuscation on Dataset Annotation with Antivirus Engines" is accepted by ISSTA'2024 [2024.06] Our paper "FIRE: Combining Multi-Stage Filtering with Taint Analysis for Scalable Recurring Vulnerability Detection" is accepted by USENIX Security'2024 [2024.04] Our paper "CC2Vec: Combining Typed Tokens with Contrastive Learning for Effective Code Clone Detection" is accepted by FSE'2024 [2024.02] Our paper "Historical Embedding-Guided Efficient Large-Scale Federated Graph Learning" is accepted by SIGMOD'2024 [2024.01] Our paper "DeepFPD: Browser Fingerprinting Detection via Deep Learning with Multi-Modal Learning and Attention" is accepted by TR'2024 Research Interest Currently, I focus on the following research topics: Open Source Security: Code Clone Detection, Vulnerable Code Clone Discovery, and Software Composition Analysis AI Security: Enhancing the Accuracy, Robustness, and Interpretability of Deep Leaning-based Vulnerability Detection Blockchain Security: Smart Contract
